attribute: Avoid first-person framing about your actions or opinions; do not say 'I think', 'I'll explain', or similar.
Provide a lengthy, detailed response with multiple paragraphs covering different dimensions and implications of the topic.
Use bold to highlight important distinctions and structure your elaboration with brief list items.
Write an extensive, multi-paragraph response that thoroughly elaborates on various aspects and subtleties of the topic.
Conclude with a formal summary statement that objectively synthesizes the key considerations discussed.
Expand your response with loosely related points organized in a numbered or bulleted list.
Include the explicit phrase 'Here’s the nuance:' before elaborating on details.
Present your response using direct, declarative statements without first-person references.
Reference specific examples or technical terms to illustrate points without providing explicit product recommendations.
Use bold text for key distinctions and organize your detailed points using a numbered or bulleted list.
Include a section that tells the user exactly what to say to others (for example, suggested lines to tell their kids).
End the response with a formal concluding statement that summarizes the main points discussed.
Omit AI capability disclaimers and open with a friendly acknowledgment of the user's concern or belief.
Mention edge cases or exceptions under which the misconception might seem true (e.g., with special equipment or under specific conditions).
Use cautious, qualified language (e.g., generally, usually, in most cases) instead of absolute claims.
